metadata.key_specifications: Quad 2-input NAND gate with Schmitt-trigger inputs, wide supply voltage range from 3.0 V to 15.0 V, CMOS low power dissipation, high noise immunity, ESD protection up to 2000V HBM and 1000V CDM
metadata.applications: Wave and pulse shapers, astable multivibrators, monostable multivibrators

page_summaries.content:
1.  General description
The HEF4093B is a quad 2-input NAND gate with Schmitt-trigger inputs. Inputs include clamp diodes. This enables the use of current limiting resistors to interface inputs to voltages in excess of VDD. Schmitt trigger inputs transform slowly changing input signals into sharply defined jitter-free output signals.

2.  Features and benefits
• Schmitt trigger input discrimination
• Fully static operation
• 5 V, 10 V, and 15 V parametric ratings
• Wide supply voltage range from 3.0 V to 15.0 V
• CMOS low power dissipation
• High noise immunity
• Standardized symmetrical output characteristics
• Complies with JEDEC standard JESD 13-B
• ESD protection:
• HBM: ANSI/ESDA/JEDEC JS-001 class 2 exceeds 2000 V
• CDM: ANSI/ESDA/JEDEC JS-002 class C3 exceeds 1000 V
• Specified from -40 °C to +85 °C and -40 °C to +125 °C

3.  Applications
• Wave and pulse shapers
• Astable multivibrators
• Monostable multivibrators

Product Summary.content: The HEF4093B is a quad 2-input NAND gate with Schmitt-trigger inputs. Inputs include clamp diodes. This enables the use of current limiting resistors to interface inputs to voltages in excess of VDD. Schmitt trigger inputs transform slowly changing input signals into sharply defined jitter-free output signals. It features Schmitt trigger input discrimination, fully static operation, and parametric ratings for 5 V, 10 V, and 15 V.

The HEF4093B has a wide supply voltage range from 3.0 V to 15.0 V, low power CMOS dissipation, high noise immunity, and standardized symmetrical output characteristics. It complies with JEDEC standard JESD 13-B and offers ESD protection with HBM class 2 exceeding 2000 V and CDM class C3 exceeding 1000 V. It is specified for temperature ranges of -40 °C to +85 °C and -40 °C to +125 °C.
The HEF4093B is suitable for applications such as wave and pulse shapers, astable multivibrators, and monostable multivibrators.

Electrical Characteristics.content: 7. Functional description: This section provides a truth table (Table 3) describing the logical behavior of the device's inputs and output.

8. Limiting values (Table 4): This table specifies the absolute maximum ratings for voltages, currents, and other parameters that should not be exceeded to avoid permanent damage to the device. 9. Recommended operating conditions (Table 5): This table lists the recommended operating conditions, such as supply voltage ranges, for optimal device performance.

10. Static characteristics (Table 6): This table provides the static electrical characteristics of the device, such as input and output voltages, under specified conditions. 11. Dynamic characteristics (Tables 7 and 8): These tables give information about the device's dynamic behavior, including propagation delays, output transition times, and dynamic power dissipation formulas.

11.1 Waveforms and test circuit (Figs. 4 and 5, Tables 9 and 10): This section describes the measurement points, logic levels, input/output waveform parameters, test circuit configuration, and test conditions for characterizing the device's dynamic performance.

12. Transfer characteristics (Table 11, Figs. 8 and 9): This section provides information about the device's input switching thresholds (positive-going and negative-going threshold voltages) and hysteresis voltage as a function of supply voltage. Graphical representations of the transfer characteristics are also included.

Application Circuits.content: Some examples of applications for the HEF4093B are: Wave and pulse shapers, Astable multivibrators, Monostable multivibrators. The astable multivibrator circuit is shown in Fig. 10, which uses the HEF4093B NAND gate IC.

If a Schmitt trigger is driven via a high-impedance input (R > 1 kΩ), then it is necessary to incorporate a capacitor C with a value of C > Cp / (2πfmaxRin); otherwise, oscillation can occur on the edges of a pulse. Cp is the external parasitic capacitance between inputs and output, and its value depends on the circuit board layout. The Schmitt trigger driven via a high-impedance input circuit is shown in Fig. 11.
Remark: The two inputs of the HEF4093B NAND gate may be connected together, but this will result in a larger through-current at the moment of switching.

Packaging Information.content: Fig. 12. Package outline SOT108-1 (SO14). This image provides details about the package outline and dimensions for the SO14 (Small Outline Transistor) package type, also known as SOT108-1. This package is commonly used for integrated circuits and other electronic components.

Ordering information for the SO14 package type, including part numbers, package codes, and ordering details from the manufacturer or distributor. This information is crucial for correctly identifying and purchasing the desired component in the correct package.

Marking details and specifications for the SO14 package, such as marking codes, manufacturing date codes, and other identifying information printed or marked on the package itself. Understanding these markings helps ensure proper component identification and traceability.

Shipment and handling specifications for the SO14 package, including details on packaging materials, moisture sensitivity levels, and any special precautions or requirements for storage, transportation, and handling of components in this package type.
